response.answer_text: Colistin was discovered in 1949 and was nonribosomally synthesized by Bacillus polymyxa subspecies colistinus Koyama . Colistin was initially used therapeutically in Japan and in Europe during the 1950s and in the United States in the form of colistimethate sodium in 1959 .

Colistin was discovered in 1950 by scientists at the Kobayashi Bacteriological Laboratory in Japan. For further details about the discovery of colistin and its entry into the market, see this freely accessible thesis: https://etheses.lse.ac.uk/2172/1/U613404.pdf.
